intro: Themistoclesia peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian velvetleaf, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in humid, lowland areas and can thrive in disturbed soils. The species is noted for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
